recipes.name: Fried Rice
recipes.description: Fried rice is a versatile and delicious dish made by stir-frying cooked rice with vegetables, protein, and flavorful seasonings.

ingredients.cooked_rice: 4 cups cooked rice, preferably chilled (day-old rice works best)

options: 8 ounces cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined

instructions: In a large skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the beaten eggs to the skillet and scramble until fully cooked. Remove the eggs from the skillet and set aside.
Add the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil to the skillet. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the diced carrots to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Add the diced protein (chicken, shrimp, tofu) to the skillet and stir-fry until heated through.
Add the frozen peas, diced bell peppers, and sliced green onions to the skillet. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Add the cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any clumps with a spatula.
Drizzle the soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and oyster sauce (if using) over the rice. Stir well to combine and evenly distribute the seasonings.
Continue to stir-fry the rice for 5-6 minutes, or until heated through and slightly crispy.
Taste the fried rice and adjust the seasoning with salt and black pepper as needed.
Return the scrambled eggs to the skillet and toss everything together until evenly mixed.
Remove the skillet from heat and transfer the fried rice to serving plates.
Garnish with sliced green onions and toasted sesame seeds.
Serve the fried rice hot, optionally garnished with chopped cilantro and accompanied by sriracha or chili sauce on the side.
Enjoy your delicious homemade Fried Rice!

recipes.name: Orange Chicken
recipes.description: Orange chicken is a popular Chinese-American dish known for its tangy, sweet, and savory flavor.

ingredients.chicken: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast or thigh, cut into bite-sized pieces

orange_sauce.cornstarch_slurry: 2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water

instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the batter until smooth.
Add the chicken pieces to the batter and toss until they are evenly coated.
In a large skillet or deep fryer, heat vegetable oil to 350°F (180°C).

Carefully add the battered chicken pieces to the hot oil in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Fry for 4-5 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Remove from the oil and drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat with the remaining chicken.
In a separate saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the orange juice, orange zest, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and brown sugar to the saucepan. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.
Bring the sauce to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Stir in the cornstarch slurry and continue to cook until the sauce has thickened, about 2 minutes.
Add the fried chicken pieces to the saucepan and toss until they are evenly coated with the orange sauce.
Garnish with thinly sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve the orange chicken hot with steamed rice or cooked noodles.
Enjoy your delicious homemade Orange Chicken!

recipes.name: Beef Broccoli
recipes.description: Beef broccoli is a classic Chinese stir-fry dish featuring tender beef and crisp broccoli in a savory sauce.

ingredients.beef: 1 lb flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain

sauce.cornstarch_slurry: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water

instructions: In a bowl, combine the thinly sliced beef with the marinade ingredients: soy sauce, rice wine, cornstarch, sesame oil, and black pepper. Let it marinate for 15-30 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix together the oyster sauce, chicken broth, and cornstarch slurry. Set aside.
Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil. Once hot, add the marinated beef and stir-fry until it's browned on the outside. Remove from the wok and set aside.
In the same wok or skillet, add another tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the broccoli florets to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until they turn bright green and are slightly tender. You may add a splash of water if needed to help cook the broccoli.
Return the beef to the wok and pour in the sauce mixture. Stir well to combine and let it cook for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and broccoli.
Garnish with sliced green onions and toasted sesame seeds.
Serve the beef broccoli hot over steamed rice.
Enjoy your delicious homemade Beef Broccoli!
